oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Receiving and managing high-risk cattle in the feedyard
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sjeklocha, David B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: receiving
management
high-risk
metaphylaxis
stress
morbidity
mortality
low-stress
cattle
feedyard
feedlot
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Receiving high-risk cattle into a feedyard can be very challenging. Good animal husbandry is especially important in these situations. Commonly, a history of the cattle is sketchy or non-existent. When these situations arise, the best vaccination and treatment program ever conceptualized will not be effective unless good cattle management practices are employed as well.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019 Recent Graduate Proceedings; 63-66
